summary:
Tahiti is the biggest island in French Polynesia, located in the Pacific Ocean near Australia. It has two parts: Tahiti Nui and Tahiti Iti, formed by volcanoes. With a population of almost 200,000, it is French Polynesia's most populated island. Tahiti is the center of French Polynesia's economy, culture, and politics. Its capital, Pape'ete, is where the region's only international airport is located. 

Originally home to Polynesians, Tahiti was annexed by France in 1880 and is now an overseas part of France. French is the official language, but many people also speak Tahitian.
title: Tahiti
